item.title: PD: AAC Mentors
item.description: Tags: #aac Code: S Type: In-person Website: AGOSCI Description: AGOSCI is excited to announce a longstanding dream to rollout an AAC Mentors program.

item.title: PD: Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Mental Health First Aid
item.description: Tags: #firstnations #aboriginal #torresstrait Code: C, S Type: Blended or in-person Website: Mental Health First Aid Description: The 14-hour Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Mental Health First Aid course is for any interested adult.

item.title: PD: ADHD & Doing Stuff
item.description: Tags: #adhd Code: S Type: Self-paced online Website: ADHD & Doing Stuff Description: The ADHD module explores attention, focus and motivation and codifies them into behaviors to help you follow through on your goals.

item.title: PD: Attention, memory and aphasia: Implications
item.description: Tags: #aphasia #language Code: S Type: Live online event (Past event) Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub Description: Evidence from aphasia literature supports the proposition that cognitive processes, such as attention and memory, influence language production and comprehension.

item.title: PD: Cluttering: How do I know if my client clutters and how can I help them if they do?
item.description: Tags: #cluttering Code: S Type: Live online Cost: $100 Website: SPA Learning Hub Description: In clinical practice, many speech pathologists feel ill-equipped to diagnose and treat cluttering.

item.title: PD: Cultural Responsiveness Training
item.description: Tags: #firstnations Code: C, S Type: Self-paced online and blended Website: IAHA Description: A cultural safety training that uses IAHA's evidence-based Cultural Responsiveness Framework.

item.title: PD: Differences between Aboriginal and standard Australian English narrative patterns
item.description: Tags: #firstnations #language Code: C, S Type: Self-paced online (90 minutes) Cost: $199 Website: SPA Learning Hub Description: Learning objectives include identifying the levels of language and becoming aware of likely areas of miscommunication with speakers of Aboriginal languages and Aboriginal English, discussing the significance of language–driven narrative patterns for practice, articulating key differences between Standard Australian English and Aboriginal narrative, developing strategies for identifying and minimising miscommunication and negative client outcomes associated with narrative differences.

item.title: PD: DIRFloortime® Courses
item.description: Tags: #autism #play Code: S Type: Live online Website: DIRFloortime® Courses Description: The DIRFloortime® Training Program is open to anyone who wants to learn the DIR® model and DIRFloortime® approach that is based on respectful, meaningful interactions that are tailored to each person's individual differences and promotes each person's development to their fullest potential.

item.title: PD: Dysphagia management and risk feeding in aged or palliative care
item.description: Tags: #swallowing #riskfeeding #agedcare #pallcare Code: S Type: Live online event (Nov 2022) (Runs over 2 sessions) Cost: $110 Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

item.title: PD: Hanen Workshops
item.description: Tags: #language #autism Code: S Type: Online Website: The Hanen Centre Description: Hanen offers a variety of intensive workshops for SLPs who work with parents and educators of young children.

item.title: PD: Implementing the National Guideline for the Diagnosis of ASD
item.description: Tags: #autism Code: S Type: Self-paced online course (4 hours to complete) Cost: $75 Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

item.title: PD: Infant feeding foundations workshop
item.description: Tags: #swallowing Code: S Type: Live online event or self-paced Cost: $350 Website: Babble & Munch Learning Description: This is an online workshop that teaches the developmental foundations of:

item.title: PD: ISAAC Webinars
item.description: Tags: #aac Code: S Type: Online Website: ISAAC Description: Current, additional and archived webinars about AAC. < Home

item.title: PD: Key Word Sign
item.description: Tags: #aac #sign Code: S Type: Blended and in-person Cost: $200 Website: Key Word Sign Australia Description: Key Word Sign is a tool or strategy which can be used to support children and adults with communication difficulties to understand and get their message across to others.

item.title: PD: Liberator AAC Modules
item.description: Tags: #aac Code: S Type: Self-paced online Website: Liberator Description: Free AAC training provided by Liberator. Includes: Foundations of AAC ACCESS training, required to access Liberator's free AAC device trial scheme < Home

item.title: PD: Lidcombe Program
item.description: Tags: #stuttering Code: S Type: Online Cost: $500 Website: Lidcombe Program Trainers Consortium Description: The Lidcombe Program is an evidence based, behavioural treatment for early stuttering.

item.title: PD: LSVT Loud
item.description: Tags: #speech #voice #progneuro #dysarthria #congenital Code: S Type: In-person or online certification Some free webinars Website: LSVT Website

item.title: PD: PROMPT
item.description: Tags: #cas #autism #congenital #speech Code: S Type: Online or in-person Website: The PROMPT Institute Description: PROMPT is widely accepted as a treatment method for children ages 6 months and older who may have autism, apraxia, dysarthria, cerebral palsy, or other motor speech disorders.

item.title: PD: SOS Education Programs
item.description: Tags: swallowing Code: S Type: Online or in-person Website: SOS Education Programs Description: The SOS Approach to Feeding Program offers comprehensive training to help you take your feeding therapy to the next level.

item.title: PD: Sounds Write
item.description: Tags: #literacy #language #dyslexia Code: S Type: Live online workshops (Feb 2023) Website: SPELD NSW Description: Sounds-Write is an evidence-based highly structured, synthetic, linguistic phonics program utilising an exciting and highly successful approach to the teaching of reading and spelling.

item.title: PD: Talk for Writing
item.description: Tags: #language #literacy Code: S Type: Live online workshops (Mar 2023) Website: Dyslexia — SPELD Foundation Description: Talk for Writing is a unique process that uses spoken activities to develop writing skills.

item.title: PD: The Greenspan Floortime Approach
item.description: Tags: #autism #play Code: S Type: In-person (USA) or online Website: Greenspan Floortime Description: Floortime is an evidence-based intervention. Research demonstrates that it strengthens fundamental communication and relationship abilities for children with autism and other special needs.

item.title: PD: Tracheostomy and Speech Pathology
item.description: Tags: #medical #swallowing Code: S Type: In-person Cost: $610 Website: QLD Health - Clinical Skills Development Service Description: Build skill and confidence in managing adult patients.

item.title: PD: TribalLink Cultural Training
item.description: Tags: #firstnations Code: C, S Type: Online (Cultural Training) or face-to-face (Cultural Awareness for Health Professionals) Website: TribalLink Description: Online Cultural Training

item.title: PD: Voicecraft Workshops
item.description: Tags: #voice Code: O Website: Voicecraft Description: Voicecraft® is an evidence-based system of knowledge and skills which facilitates the restoration and optimisation of the voice.

item.title: PD: Youth Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Mental Health First Aid
item.description: Tags: #firstnations #aboriginal #torresstrait Code: C, S Type: Blended or in-person Website: Mental Health First Aid Description: The Youth Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Mental Health First Aid course is for any interested adults, 18 years and over.

item.title: PEERS® for adolescents certified training seminar: Caregiver-assisted intervention
item.description: #socialcom Tags: #socialcom Code: S Type: Online (3 sessions) Cost: $500 USD Website: Semel Institute for Neuroscience and Human Behavior
